Identification.ShortTitle: Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg and Chick Licensing Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Establishment of a System of Licensing of Persons Engaged in the Marketing in Interprovincial or Export Trade of Broiler Hatching Eggs or Chicks Produced for Chicken Production

Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council has, by the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency Proclamation*, established the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency, pursuant to subsection 17(1) of the Farm Products Marketing Agencies Act**;
And Whereas the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency has been empowered to implement a marketing plan pursuant to the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency Proclamation*;

Therefore, the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency, pursuant to paragraph 23(1)(f) of the Farm Products Marketing Agencies Act** and section 7 of the schedule to the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency Proclamation*, hereby makes the annexed Regulations respecting the establishment of a system of licensing of persons engaged in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production, effective October 1, 1987.

The National Farm Products Marketing Council, pursuant to paragraph 7(1)(e) of the Farm Products Marketing Agencies Act*, being satisfied that the annexed Regulations are necessary for the administration of the marketing plan that the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency is authorized to implement, hereby approves the annexed Regulations respecting the establishment of a system of licensing of persons engaged in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production, made by the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg Marketing Agency on June 30, 1987.

Footnote.Text: SOR/87-40, 1987 Canada Gazette Part II, p. 317

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg and Chick Licensing Regulations.

Definition.Text: buyer means a chicken producer, dealer or hatchery operator who buys broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production; (acheteur)
licence means a buyer’s licence or a seller’s licence issued pursuant to section 5; (permis)
seller means a producer, dealer or hatchery operator who sells broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production. (vendeur)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to persons engaged in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced in a signatory province for chicken production; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to persons engaged in the interprovincial marketing from a non-signatory province into a signatory province of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced in the non-signatory province for chicken production.

Subsection.Text: These Regulations do not apply to buyers — whose province of operation is set out in column 1 of the table to this subsection — engaged in the interprovincial trade of chicks produced for chicken production and who, in a calendar year, purchase for on-farm consumption no more than the permitted number of chicks set out in column 2.

row.entry: Permitted Number of Chicks per Calendar Year

Subsection.Text: Buyers referred to in subsection (1) must not knowingly engage in the marketing in interprovincial trade of chicks produced for chicken production except with a person who holds an appropriate licence issued by the Agency under these Regulations and, in the case of chicks produced in a non-signatory province, unless the person holds an orderly marketing quota issued under the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg and Chick Orderly Marketing Regulations.

Section.Text: These Regulations apply to the sellers of chicks who sell to the buyers referred to in subsection 3.1(1).

Subsection.Text: No buyer shall engage in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced in a signatory province for chicken production unless the buyer holds a buyer’s licence.

No seller shall engage in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced in a signatory province for chicken production unless the seller holds a seller’s licence.

No buyer shall engage in the interprovincial marketing from a non-signatory province into a signatory province of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production unless the buyer holds a buyer’s licence.

No seller shall engage in the interprovincial marketing from a non-signatory province into a signatory province of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production unless the seller holds a seller’s licence.

Section.Text: Subject to section 8, the Agency shall issue a licence to any person who applies for one.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: expires on December 31 of the year for which it is issued; and

Section.Text: A licence is subject to the following terms and conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom a licence is issued

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at all times during the term of the licence complies with the orders, regulations or requirements of the Agency or the National Farm Products Council that are applicable to that person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: at all times during the term of the licence complies with the orders, regulations or directives made pursuant to a provincial broiler hatching egg marketing plan referred to in the Federal-Provincial Agreement for Broiler Hatching Eggs, authorized by Order in Council P.C. 1986-2653*, that are applicable to that person,

Footnote.Text: Not published in the Canada Gazette, Part II.

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: submits to the Agency in respect of the period set out in the licence a report containing the information set out in the schedule, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: keeps complete and accurate books and records of all matters related to the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs or chicks produced for chicken production by the person and retains the books and records for a period of not less than six years after the day of the last entry therein; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom a licence is issued does not knowingly engage

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the marketing in interprovincial trade of chicks except with a person who holds an appropriate licence or who is a buyer referred to in subsection 3.1(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the marketing in interprovincial or export trade of broiler hatching eggs produced in a signatory province, except for broiler hatching eggs that have been produced by a producer who has been allotted an interprovincial quota or export quota pursuant to the Canadian Hatching Egg Producers Quota Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the interprovincial marketing from a non-signatory province into a signatory province of broiler hatching eggs produced in the non-signatory province, except for broiler hatching eggs that have been marketed by a person who has been allotted an orderly marketing quota pursuant to the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg and Chick Orderly Marketing Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The Agency may refuse to issue a licence to an applicant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: who is a producer, if the applicant has not been allotted a quota by the Agency pursuant to the Canadian Broiler Hatching Egg and Chick Orderly Marketing Quota Regulations or the Canadian Hatching Egg Producers Quota Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant does not comply with any order, regulation or requirement of the Agency or the National Farm Products Council that is applicable to the applicant; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant does not comply with any order, regulation or directive made pursuant to a provincial broiler hatching egg marketing plan referred to in the Federal-Provincial Agreement for Broiler Hatching Eggs, authorized by Order in Council P.C. 1986-2653*, that is applicable to the applicant.

Footnote.Text: Not published in the Canada Gazette Part II.

Subsection.Text: Where a person to whom a licence was issued fails to comply with any term or condition to which the licence is subject, the Agency may suspend, cancel or refuse to renew the licence.

Where the Agency intends to refuse to issue or renew a licence or intends to suspend or cancel a licence, the Agency shall give notice of its intention to the applicant or the person to whom the licence was issued by personal service or registered mail.
The notice referred to in subsection (1) shall set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds on which the Agency bases its intention; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which and the time and place at which the applicant or the person to whom the licence was issued may show cause why the licence should be issued or renewed or should not be suspended or cancelled.

Subsection.Text: The day referred to in paragraph (2)(b) shall be not less than 30 days after the day of the service or mailing of the notice.

Provision.Text: Name, address and licence number of the person to whom the licence was issued.
The quantity of broiler hatching eggs or chicks, marketed in interprovincial or export trade during the period set out in the licence.
The name, address and licence number of the licencee from whom the broiler hatching eggs or chicks were bought or to whom the broiler hatching eggs or chicks were sold.
In the case of broiler hatching eggs, the price at which the broiler hatching eggs were bought or sold.
In the case of broiler hatching eggs for export, the name and address of the buyer, the name of the transporter, the date of export and the place of final destination.
